titles.title: A bill to amend the Lanham Act to prevent the admission into the United States of articles of imported merchandise that are labeled with the name of a foreign country in contravention of the law of the country.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice.

committee.subcommittee: Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary: 9/15/1988--Introduced. Amends Federal law prohibiting the importation of trademark-infringing goods to proscribe the importation of goods bearing the name of a foreign country or locality whose laws forbid that its name be used in such a manner.
